channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10601] Upgrade hadoop dependency to 2.3.0 release
item.description:
Apache Hadoop 2.3.0 has been released.

This issue is to upgrade hadoop dependency to 2.3.0

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Should we rather have 2.2 and 2.3 as an option, and default to 2.3?
Here's what I had in mind for 0.94. I was planning to do that in a separate jira, but might as well do it here. Note the change for protobuf specific to the Hadoop version.

Patch v1 is for trunk (0.99).

For 0.94, I am fine with Lars' patch.
Andrew Purtell, stack, any opinions for 0.96 and 0.98?
Not in 0.96.
I meant the optional profile for Hadoop 2.3 (like in my 0.94 patch). Neither 0.96 not 0.98 should just change the default.
Pardon me. Adding profile is useful.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12630807/10601-v1.txt
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12630807

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop1.1. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.1 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.TestHBaseFsck

This message is automatically generated.
Patch for 0.98

HadoopQA doesn't enable the new profile so it's results here are not useful. Can you attach the final result of a 'mvn test -Dhadoop.profile=2.3' Ted? Trunk will be sufficient.

Should we add more profiles to HadoopQA in addition to 1.0 and 1.1 as follow on work?

Should we add more profiles to HadoopQA in addition to 1.0 and 1.1

You mean adding compilation step against hadoop 2.2.0 in dev-support/test-patch.sh ?

Will attach result of mvn build against 2.3 profile.

You mean adding compilation step against hadoop 2.2.0 in dev-support/test-patch.sh ?

Yes, now that trunk has moved to 2.3.0 by default but 0.96 and 0.98 still use 2.2.0.
I am waiting for 2.3.0 artifacts to show up in http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.hadoop/
Here is mvn output when building 0.98 with -Dhadoop.profile=2.3
Here is patch v2 that adds 2.3 hadoop profile for 0.98

Can we do this without profiles? If we can compile trunk/0.98/0.96 with just providing -Dhadoop.version=2.3.0 that will be simpler. I do not want to end up with profiles for 2.2, 2.3, 2.4, etc if they are all source compatible.
I'd say stick with profiles in 0.94, 0.96, and 0.98. Can rethink things for 0.99.

I tried the following command in 0.98 :


mvn clean -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 -Dhadoop-two.version=2.3.0 package -DskipTests

I got:


[ERROR] The build could not read 1 project -> [Help 1]

[ERROR]

[ERROR]   The project org.apache.hbase:hbase:0.98.1-SNAPSHOT (/Users/tyu/98/pom.xml) has 2 errors

[ERROR]     'dependencyManagement.dependencies.dependency.artifactId' for org.apache.hbase:${compat.module}:jar with value '${compat.module}' does not match a valid id     pattern. @ line 997, column 21

[ERROR]     'dependencyManagement.dependencies.dependency.artifactId' for org.apache.hbase:${compat.module}:test-jar with value '${compat.module}' does not match a valid   id pattern. @ line 1002, column 21

[ERROR]

[ERROR] To see the full stack trace of the errors, re-run Maven with the -e switch.

[ERROR] Re-run Maven using the -X switch to enable full debug logging.

[ERROR]

[ERROR] For more information about the errors and possible solutions, please read the following articles:

[ERROR] [Help 1] http://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/MAVEN/ProjectBuildingException

This was due to hadoop.profile=2.0 being the default profile in 0.98 (and trunk)

The command given above works for 0.96 :

mvn clean -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 -Dhadoop-two.version=2.3.0 package -DskipTests

It is because our pom.xml fails if you give the default profile in hadoop.profile. Meaning, if you want to compile 0.98 and trunk with hadoop2, you should NOT specify a profile, while in 0.96 you SHOULD provide the hadoop.profile parameter. That is unfortunate but it is how it works for now.

I am running test suite locally to try to reproduce the hanging test.

From QA run 8858:


"pool-1-thread-1" prio=10 tid=0x74a00c00 nid=0x4527 in Object.wait() [0x74bfe000]

   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (on object monitor)

        at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)

        at java.lang.Thread.join(Thread.java:1194)

        - locked <0x812340f8> (a org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.JVMClusterUtil$RegionServerThread)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.Threads.threadDumpingIsAlive(Threads.java:117)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.LocalHBaseCluster.join(LocalHBaseCluster.java:401)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.MiniHBaseCluster.waitUntilShutDown(MiniHBaseCluster.java:674)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.shutdownMiniHBaseCluster(HBaseTestingUtility.java:971)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.shutdownMiniCluster(HBaseTestingUtility.java:944)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal.TestLogRollPeriod.tearDownAfterClass(TestLogRollPeriod.java:70)

Can we do this without profiles? If we can compile trunk/0.98/0.96 with just providing -Dhadoop.version=2.3.0 that will be simpler. I do not want to end up with profiles for 2.2, 2.3, 2.4, etc if they are all source compatible.

Makes sense, I can build 0.98 successfully with alternate Hadoop 2 versions by defining hadoop.version and hadoop-two.version. I believe only the latter is needed but I define both for good measure. Up to and including 2.4.0-SNAPSHOT seem to work fine.

Does "10601-0.98-v2.txt" only add a cut and paste of the Hadoop 2 profile with the addition of a new variable "hadoop-two-dot-three.version"? Can we just define hadoop-two.version=2.3.0 with the existing Hadoop 2 profile?

Does "10601-0.98-v2.txt" only add a cut and paste of the Hadoop 2 profile with the addition of a new variable "hadoop-two-dot-three.version"?

Yes.

Can we just define hadoop-two.version=2.3.0 with the existing Hadoop 2 profile?

Yes.
Ok, then no need for a 0.98 patch then Thanks Ted.
Are you Okay with trunk patch, Andrew Purtell ?

Are you Okay with trunk patch

+1, precommit tests look good, let's go for it.

Lars Hofhansl:
Do you want to integrate 0.94 patch using this JIRA or in a separate issue ?
